column4: The Gandalf Awards honor excellent writing in in fantasy literature.
column5: The Gandalf Awards, honoring achievement in fantasy literature, were conferred by the World Science Fiction Society annually from 1974 to 1981.

column4: The Gandalf Awards honor excellent writing in in fantasy literature.
column5: They were named for Gandalf the wizard, from the Middle-earth stories by J. R. R. Tolkien.

column4: The Gandalf Awards honor excellent writing in in fantasy literature.
column5: The award was created and sponsored by Lin Carter and the Swordsmen and Sorcerers' Guild of America (SAGA), an association of fantasy writers.

column4: The Gandalf Awards honor excellent writing in in fantasy literature.
column5: Recipients were selected by vote of participants in the World Science Fiction Conventions according to procedures of the older Hugo Awards.

column4: The Gandalf Awards honor excellent writing in in fantasy literature.
column5: The awards were presented in two categories, for life achievement and for a book published during the preceding year.
